channel.title: CVE Feed for Jenkins Project -- Jenkins
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Jenkins Project -- Jenkins

item.title: CVE-2022-20612|2024-08-03T02:17:53.077Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins 2.329 and earlier, LTS 2.319.1 and earlier allows attackers to trigger build of job without parameters when no security realm is set.

item.title: CVE-2022-34171|2024-08-03T08:16:17.200Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: In Jenkins 2.321 through 2.355 (both inclusive) and LTS 2.332.1 through LTS 2.332.3 (both inclusive) the HTML output generated for new symbol-based SVG icons includes the 'title' attribute of 'l:ionicon' (until Jenkins 2.334) and 'alt' attribute of 'l:icon' (since Jenkins 2.335) without further escaping, resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-41224|2024-08-03T12:35:49.640Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: Jenkins 2.367 through 2.369 (both inclusive) does not escape tooltips of the l:helpIcon UI component used for some help icons on the Jenkins web UI, resulting in a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers able to control tooltips for this component.

item.title: CVE-2022-34170|2024-08-03T08:16:17.207Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: In Jenkins 2.320 through 2.355 (both inclusive) and LTS 2.332.1 through LTS 2.332.3 (both inclusive) the help icon does not escape the feature name that is part of its tooltip, effectively undoing the fix for SECURITY-1955, resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers with Job/Configure permission.

item.title: CVE-2022-34175|2024-08-03T08:16:17.220Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: Jenkins 2.335 through 2.355 (both inclusive) allows attackers in some cases to bypass a protection mechanism, thereby directly accessing some view fragments containing sensitive information, bypassing any permission checks in the corresponding view.

item.title: CVE-2022-34172|2024-08-03T08:16:17.202Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: In Jenkins 2.340 through 2.355 (both inclusive) symbol-based icons unescape previously escaped values of 'tooltip' parameters, resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-34174|2024-08-03T08:16:17.136Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: In Jenkins 2.355 and earlier, LTS 2.332.3 and earlier, an observable timing discrepancy on the login form allows distinguishing between login attempts with an invalid username, and login attempts with a valid username and wrong password, when using the Jenkins user database security realm.

item.title: CVE-2022-34173|2024-08-03T08:16:17.034Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins
item.description: In Jenkins 2.340 through 2.355 (both inclusive) the tooltip of the build button in list views supports HTML without escaping the job display name, resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers with Job/Configure permission.
